column1: The following grounds of Appeal were urged by the counsel for the Accused.

column2: 1.  The Learned High Court Judge erred in law in allowing the prosecution to ask leading
questions  to  the  detriment  of  the  appellant  contrary  to  the  principle  upheld  in  the
judgment in S.C. Appeal 118/17 decided on 09.11.2018.

column1: The facts and circumstances giving rise to this Appeal are that:

column2: According  to  the  prosecutrix,  PW  01  testified  that  while  she  was  returning  from

column1: school, she and her sister and two friends stopped near a mango tree to pluck mangoes, while
they were plucking the Accused approached them and threatened them that he would inform
them to the police. Thereafter the sister and one of the friends ran away. PW01 and her friend
Dilakshana (PW11) remained. The Accused dragged her into the jungle, where she fainted.
